135321121.content:
Max awoke with a jolt. The steady droning of Mrs. Hoida’s lecture must have hit Max harder than she thought. The English teacher paused her lecture long enough to ask a question of the class. Kate had her hand in the air and was providing the answer in almost an instant. Max smiled at how much better Kate seemed to be doing. The memories of what Kate had gone through still troubled Max, even if that timeline had ceased to exist.

On that thought, Max’s hand snaked down to rub her bullet wound. Max couldn’t believe how much it hurt when she knocked Nathan aside in the girls bathroom and ended up taking the bullet that had been meant for Chloe. Max even ended up blacking out from the pain. She still managed to hear Chloe crying out in shock and surprise that Max had appeared back in her life again like that.

Despite the pain, she was still glad that act had put an end to Mr. Jefferson’s sadistic photo shoots and all the other trouble throughout that week. On the other hand, Max had lost her time travel abilities as well. Plenty of tries since that last trip had had no result at all. Stopping everything at that time also meant that this version of Chloe hadn’t gone on the five days of adventure and hardship that had led to that pivotal moment on the cliff with the tornado tearing into Arcadia Bay.

Speaking of… Max realized that during her sudden and unexpected nap, she had dreamed again. The dream had seemed so real, just like the one that she had back in Mr. Jefferson’s class. It even started off the same way, the rain pelting her in icy sheets, the roar of the tornado as it destroyed everything in its path, and the havoc it caused in the city as it did so. Then the dream twisted and warped. The tornado became a whirlpool that formed in the bottle of soda that Chloe chugged with abandon. And what a Chloe it was. Gone was the skinny young woman she had been, and in her place was an enormous bloated and blubbery replacement. Max had shivered in delight as the fleshy woman before her finished off the bottle of soda before demanding more food. Max provided it with glee, watching a mountain of food be devoured piece by piece by an ever growing mountain of Chloe.

It was all Max could do to not moan right there in class as the dream floated around her brain, as real as a normal memory. She had to bite down on the inside of her cheek and grip the edge of her table till her knuckles were white. The sound of the bell signaling the end of class couldn’t have come at a better time. Mrs. Hoida raised her voice to give a last minute homework assignment. Max paid only half attention to her though, more focused on packing up and taking off. With Mr. Jefferson indisposed, she had free time till later that afternoon, and she had plans to meet up with Chloe. Max though of discussing the dream with Chloe, but decided against it. She would rather keep her weighty taste to herself.

All packed up with her camera ready to go at a moment’s notice, Max headed out of the school. The bus arrived soon after and she was on her way.

1353211211.content:
The town and the water beyond flashed past the bus window. Max sat back as she listened to her music. There was a chill in the air, and already a few hints of snow. No one showed any worry about it, no one but Max that was. She couldn’t help but be a bit concerned seeing it, despite knowing that it wasn’t all that unusual for this time of year. All the strange happenings of that week had left their mark.

Stepping off the bus, she couldn’t stop her eye from wandering to the beach where all those whales had died. In her mind’s eye, she could still see them laid out along the entire length of the beach. Max shook her head, turned the collar of her jacket up higher and walked towards the Two Whales Diner. She shuddered a bit as she thought of the damage she had seen inflicted on the place, including when she saw it explode. She again shook off the bad memories before heading inside.

Before Max was even through the door, the wonderful smells hit her like a brick wall. It set her stomach rumbling despite the breakfast she had grabbed earlier. Looking back and forth, she saw that Chloe was late as usual. She slipped past the lunch crowd, greeting those that recognized her. More than a few still praised her for her selfless act in throwing herself at Nathan. It made Max feel more than a little embarrassed to hear it again.

The photographer took a seat at the same booth she had before, giving her a good view of the door and the beach. Joyce came soon after, a smile on her face and a warm coffee in her hand. Several minutes passed with Joyce greeting Max as well as thanking her again for stepping in and saving Chloe. After some further small talk, Max ordered lunch before starting to drink her coffee.

Max’s order was starting to come up when the door banged open and a familiar pair of boots started clomping across the floor. Chloe’s only major sacrifice due to the cooling weather was that her jeans were less ripped than her usual ones were. The blue haired punk rocker hopped in the seat across from Max with her usual surly scowl.

“Heya, super-Max, you been having any more time traveling adventures?” she said with a slight laugh.

Max sighed before answering. “No, Chloe, you know that all went away after I saved you that last time.”

“Yeah, yeah, doesn’t hurt to check it from time to time,” Chloe said, waving a hand back and forth. “Though it was the first time you saved my life for me. It would have been nice for you to still have your powers though.”

“I think I would have rather have had bullet resistance at that time,” Max said with a sour tone.

Chloe’s face fell even further at that, she muttered an apology as well as her own thanks. It hadn’t been quite as easy to convince this version of Chloe about the time travel, in no small part to not having them to perform a test like the last time. Max’s knowledge of Nathan, Jefferson, along with what had happened to Rachel, and everything else proved to be enough though.

Into the lull of conversation fell the mental image of the enormous Chloe. It superimposed itself over the Chloe sitting before Max. She could almost imagine the fleshy form of the dreamed Chloe overflowing the booth seat. How her mammoth stomach sagged out and down, and even oozed over a bit of the table. Chloe’s shirt was barely able to hold back the far larger breasts that were too much for the bra beneath. The longer she focused on the image, the more real it felt to Max. It almost felt like she could reach out and bury her hand in the thick layer of fat. Her fingers trembled as she started to lift her hand up–

A plate appearing before her jolted Max out of her fantasy.“Here you go, Max. You want a refill?” Joyce said as she sat the plate down and motioned towards the almost coffee cup before Max.

Clearing her throat, Max shook her head before stammering that she did want some more coffee. Chloe arched a brow and asked if Max was feeling alright. Max managed to say that she was a bit distracted, that was all. Chloe looked ready to push the question further, but Joyce chided Chloe before she could get started. Chloe scowled but didn’t take it beyond that. She then muttered her own order to her mother before sitting back with a huff.

That was so weird Max thought as she took a bit of her sandwich. It felt so real. Something at the back of her brain seemed to say that she could make it real. It wasn’t a voice, it wasn’t even the words. It was only a vague sense or awareness that assured her she could make it happen. She had no idea where it came from though. It was absurd as well…but what if it was true? What if she really could have Chloe be fat? That vague sense at the back of her mind seemed to say that all she had to do was concentrate, and it would be so. Despite the freakiness, Max found herself focusing on the image of Chloe being fatter.
